quote: Works of art make rules, rules don't make works of art.
author: Claude Debussy

quote: “Intel Inside” is a Government Warning required by Law.
author: Unknown

quote: “That hardly ever happens” is another way of saying “it happens”.
author: Douglas Crockford

quote: 1. Good design is innovative 2. Good design makes a product useful 3. Good design is aesthetic 4. Good design makes a product understandable 5. Good design is unobtrusive 6. Good design is honest 7. Good design is long-lasting 8. Good design is thorough, down to the last detail 9. Good design is environmentally friendly 10. Good design is as little design as possible.
author: Dieter Rams

quote: A beef filet cooked for 15 hours by 30 cooks doesn’t necessarily taste better than a cheeseburger.
author: Oliver Reichenstein

quote: A brand is the promise of an experience.
author: Alexander Isley

quote: A camel is a horse designed by a committee.
author: Sir Alec Issigonis

quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: A complex system that works is invariably found to have evolved from a simple system that worked. The inverse proposition also appears to be true: A complex system designed from scratch never works and cannot be made to work. You have to start over, beginning with a working simple system.
author: John Gall

quote: A computer program does what you tell it to do, not what you want it to do.
author: Unknown

quote: A computer without Photoshop is like a dog with no legs. Sure is fun, but you can’t really do anything with it.
author: Benjamin Cavanagh

quote: A confident client will see your confidence as strength, not arrogance.
author: Diti Katona

quote: A customer is the most important visitor on our premises. He is not dependent on us. We are dependent on him. He is not an interruption of our work. He is the purpose of it. He is not an outsider to our business. He is part of it. We are not doing him a favour by serving him. He is doing us a favour by giving us the opportunity to do so.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A customer is the most important visitor on our premises.He is not dependent on us. We are dependent on him.He is not an interruption of our work. He is the purpose of it.He is not an outsider to our business. He is part of it.We are not doing him a favour by serving him.He is doing us a favour by giving us the opportunity to do so.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A design is a designer’s mind in a suit.
author: Nasa Munir

quote: A designer can mull over complicated designs for months. Then suddenly the simple, elegant, beautiful solution occurs to him. When it happens to you, it feels as if God is talking! And maybe He is.
author: Leo Frankowski

quote: A designer is a planner with an aesthetic sense.
author: Bruno Munari

quote: A designer is an emerging synthesis of artist, inventor, mechanic, objective economist and evolutio­nary strategist.
author: Buckminster Fuller

quote: A designer who gives her art away, makes no pay. A designer who keeps her art to herself, makes no friends.
author: Amber Seree Allen

quote: A designer, like an archaeologist or geologist; researches, uncovers and adds context to precious, overlooked treasures by digging deep beneath the surface.
author: Scott Theisen

quote: A drawing should have no unnecessary lines and a machine no unnecessary parts.
author: William Strunk Jr.

quote: A friend once insisted to me that the plural of “moron” is “focus group.”
author: Ethan Marcotte

quote: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: A good design can feel like something you have always been waiting for without knowing.
author: Paul Huizinga

quote: A good design is driven by needs and defined by constraints.
author: Astik Pant

quote: A good design solves a problem. A bad design creates many.
author: Samadara Ginige

quote: A good designer finds an elegant way to put everything you need on a page. A great designer convinces you half that shit is unnecessary.
author: Mike Monteiro

quote: A good designer may not have all the answers, but he knows which questions to ask.
author: Rudy Duke

quote: A good portfolio will get you an interview. A good attitude will get you a job.
author: Marty Amsler

quote: A good programmer looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Unknown

quote: A good way to stay flexible is to write less code.
author: Pragmatic Programmer

quote: A graphic designer is a machine that turns coffee into beautiful, functional imagery.
author: Lisa Manson

quote: A great logo isn’t going to make a shitty product any less shitty, any more than a hard worker is going to make a bad boss a compelling leader.
author: Christopher Simmons

quote: A healthy creative process should be able to give a coherent rationale to a client as to why you designed what you designed.
author: Von Glitschka

quote: A hunch is creativity trying to tell you something.
author: Frank Capra

quote: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
author: Sir Winston Churchill

quote: A logo doesn’t sell, it identifies. A logo derives its meaning from the quality of the thing it symbolizes, not the other way around. A logo is less important than the product it signifies; what it means is more important than what it looks like.
author: Paul Rand

quote: A lot of companies have tried to support designers by giving them “a seat at the table.” What this usually means in practice, however, is that a designer is sitting at the table well after the important product decisions that influence the design have been made. This is usually where complicated and muddy designs are born.
author: Rebekah Cox

quote: A lot of people in this business develop huge egos. Why? None of us is curing cancer. None of us is saving babies from burning buildings. We’re just a bunch of overpaid knuckleheads who think up nutty stuff for some other knuckleheads’ products.
author: Paul Howalt

quote: A lot of the things about design that tend to get designers really interested aren’t that important.
author: Michael Bierut

quote: A man who stops advertising to save money is like a man who stops a clock to save time.
author: Henry Ford

quote: A man who would letterspace lower case would steal sheep, Frederic Goudy liked to say. If this wisdom needs updating, it is chiefly to say that a woman who would letterspace lower case would steal sheep as well.
author: Robert Bringhurst

quote: A man who would letterspace lower case would steal sheep.
author: Frederic Goudy

quote: A mathematician is a device for turning coffee into theorems.
author: Paul Erdos

quote: A misplaced decimal point will always end up where it will do the greatest damage.
author: Unknown

quote: A mystery is the most stimulating force in unleashing the imagination.
author: Zuzana Licko and Rudy VanderLans

quote: A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: A perfect implementation of the wrong specification is worthless. By the same principle a beautifully crafted library with no documentation is also damn near worthless. If your software solves the wrong problem or nobody can figure out how to use it, there’s something very bad going on.
author: Tom Preston-Werner

quote: A person tends to critique a design in one of several ways. The most common, and usually least valuable, is by gut reaction.
author: D. Keith Robinson

quote: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: A picture is worth a thousand dollars.
author: Marty Neumeier

quote: A picture is worth a thousand words. An interface is worth a thousand pictures.
author: Ben Shneiderman

quote: A portfolio as pretty as pictures is nothing but a tip of the iceberg, the real treasure underlies the ocean.
author: Shawn Lukas

quote: A successful design career is possible without forfeiting self-respect as long as you do not undervalue (or overvalue) your work.
author: Peter Landt

quote: A user interface is like a joke. If you have to explain it, it’s not that good.
author: Martin LeBlanc

quote: A well-defined problem is half solved.
author: Michael Osborne

quote: A well-designed text will seem weightless after a time; the initial feel of the book fades away as the mind becomes engrossed in the words.
author: Mandy Brown

quote: A work of art is one of mystery, the one extreme magic; everything else is either arithmetic or biology.
author: Truman Capote

quote: ASCII stupid question, get a stupid ANSI!
author: Unknown

quote: Ability proceeds from a fusion of skills, knowledge, understanding and imagination, consolidated by experience.
author: Jonathan Rez

quote: Accidents often produce the best solutions… only you can recognize the difference between an accident and your original intent.
author: Jennifer Morla

quote: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later!
author: Fred Brooks

quote: Advertising = Hey You + Buy Something.
author: Craig Damrauer

quote: Advertising is the art of convincing people to spend money they don’t have for something they don’t need.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Advertising is the one industry where all the experts seem to be the people who don’t work in it.
author: William Childs

quote: Advertising projects, graphic design jobs, architecture assignments, filmmaking, and pretty much every other professional creative service usually begins with smart, talented people shaking hands across a table, and ends in finger-pointing and regret – like a Country & Western love song.
author: Jeffrey Zeldman

quote: After finishing a design you take a step back and a little voice pops in your head and says, “Wow. You should really just quit while you’re ahead.” Don’t ever listen to that voice. Ever.
author: Brittany Grabowski

quote: Against stupidity, the gods themselves contend in vain.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: All are lunatics, but he who can analyze his delusion is called a philosopher.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: All computers wait at the same speed.
author: Unknown

quote: All of the buildings, all of those cars were once just a dream in somebody’s head.
author: Peter Gabriel

quote: All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know it’s normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work … It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions … It’s gonna take awhile … You’ve just gotta fight your way through.
author: Ira Glass

quote: All projects are different, but you have treat each one with care. Sometimes you get to build a luxury yacht; other times, it’ll be a rowboat. You still have to make sure the thing doesn’t spring a leak.
author: Stefan G. Bucher

quote: All the Photoshop filters in the world won’t save a weak design.
author: William Childs

quote: All the magic, be it in code or design, starts with a clear mind, pen and a blank paper.
author: Brian Wangila

quote: All things are designed, just some things more thoughtfully than others.
author: Arman Nobari

quote: All you need is love. But a new pair of shoes never hurt anybody.
author: Unknown

quote: Almost everything – all external expectations, all pride, all fear of embarrassment or failure – these things just fall away in the face of death, leaving only what is truly important.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Martin Golding

quote: Always design a thing by considering it in its next larger context – a chair in a room, a room in a house, a house in an environment, an environment in a city plan.
author: Eliel Saarinen

quote: Always give a little more than you promise.
author: The Studebaker Brothers

quote: Always read with a pen in hand. The pen should be used both to mark the text you want to remember and to write from where the text leaves you. Think of the text as the starting point for your own words.
author: Mandy Brown

quote: An ad should be an appetizer, not a buffet.
author: Lee Clow's Beard

quote: An electrician isn’t an opinion former, but a graphic designer is. My argument is that all graphic designers hold high levels of responsibility in society. We take invisible ideas and make them tangible. That’s our job.
author: Neville Brody

quote: An enterprise’s most vital assets lie in its design and other creative capabilities.
author: Kun-Hee Lee

quote: An inconvenience is only an adventure wrongly considered; an adventure is an inconvenience rightly considered.
author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

quote: An inexperienced observer sees everything in a picture; the experienced one sees even the things that are missing.
author: Rastko Ciric

quote: An old surrealist trick was to take images that had no business being together and plopping them into the same image. Your mind wants to make associations. Design does that all the time.
author: Art Chantry

quote: An organization that treats its programmers as morons will soon have programmers that are willing and able to act like morons only.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: And so we have an issue. A classic impasse. Management wants process. Developers want to build something that works. Designers want to spend time thinking about use cases. What do we do?
author: Ben Bleikamp

quote: Any attempt to separate design, to make it a thing-by-itself, works counter to the inherent value of design as the primary, underlying matrix of life.
author: Victor Papanek

quote: Any fool can use a computer. Many do.
author: Ted Nelson

quote: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius – and a lot of courage – to move in the opposite direction.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Any product that needs a manual to work is broken.
author: Elon Musk

quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: Any system that sees aesthetics as irrelevant, that separates the artist from the product, that fragments the work of the individual, or creates by committee, or makes mincemeat of the creative process will in the long run diminish not only the product but the maker as well.
author: Paul Rand

quote: Apparently there is nothing that cannot happen today.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Art does not reproduce what we see; rather, it makes us see.
author: Paul Klee

quote: Art has to move you and design does not, unless it’s a good design for a bus.
author: David Hockney

quote: Art is I; science is we.
author: Claude Bernard

quote: Art is an idea that has found its perfect visual expression. And design is the vehicle by which this expression is made possible. Art is a noun, and design is a noun and also a verb. Art is a product and design is a process. Design is the foundation of all the arts.
author: Paul Rand

quote: Art is like masturbation. It is selfish and introverted and done for you and you alone. Design is like sex. There is someone else involved, their needs are just as important as your own, and if everything goes right, both parties are happy in the end.
author: Colin Wright

quote: Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: Artificial Intelligence usually beats natural stupidity.
author: Unknown

quote: Artists are natural marketers for everyone but themselves.
author: Oren Sherman

quote: As a designer, I find it difficult not to judge a book by its cover.
author: Jordan Manigo

quote: As a graphic designer, I like to collaborate. I don’t want to be in a cold garret somewhere smoking unfiltered Camels all by myself with paint all over my body.
author: Carin Goldberg

quote: As a profession, graphic designers have been shamefully remiss or ineffective about plying their craft for social or political betterment.
author: Steven Heller

quote: As if a device can function if it has no style. As if a device can be called stylish that does not function superbly… yes, beauty matters. Boy, does it matter. It is not surface, it is not an extra, it is the thing itself.
author: Stephen Fry

quote: As long as there are people, there will be user experience, and user interface designers.
author: Steve McGarry

quote: As we know, There are known knowns. There are things we know we know. We also know There are known unknowns. That is to say We know there are some things We do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns, The ones we don’t know We don’t know.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: As we know,There are known knowns.There are things we know we know.We also knowThere are known unknowns.That is to sayWe know there are some thingsWe do not know.But there are also unknown unknowns,The ones we don’t knowWe don’t know.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: As with most social phenomena, social-network success tends to happen more organically and unpredictably than anyone is able to artificially create by throwing money at it.
author: Marco Arment

quote: At the age of six I wanted to be a cook. At seven I wanted to be Napoleon. And my ambition has been growing steadily ever since.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: At the end of the day, pretty colors make people drool.
author: Nathan Rice

quote: At this point in experience design’s evolution, satisfaction ought to be the norm, and delight out to be the goal.
author: Stephen Anderson

quote: Babe Ruth was a Home Run king but he was also a strike out king. Always go for the fences, even if it means some designs strike out with clients. That’s the only way to hit a home run.
author: Alex Zevallos

quote: Bad design is smoke, while good design is a mirror.
author: Juan-Carlos Fernandez

quote: Bad design shouts at you. Good design is the silent seller.
author: Shane Meendering

quote: Be a first rate version of yourself, not a second rate version of someone else.
author: Judy Garland

quote: Be a part of the innovation that leads the wave. Don’t wait for technology to catch up to you or you’ll end up sliding down the back side of that wave. If you choose to be a part of it happening, you can ride on top.
author: Jon Landau

quote: Be careful with each other, so you can be dangerous together.
author: Unknown

quote: Be curious. Read widely. Try new things. I think a lot of what people call intelligence boils down to curiosity.
author: Aaron Schwartz

quote: Be fluid. Treat each project differently. Be water, man. The best style is no style. Because styles can be figured out. And when you have no style they can’t figure you out.
author: Jay-Z

quote: Be friendly to those who enjoy your work and friendlier to those who attack it.
author: David Leggett

quote: Be nice to people on your way up because you meet them on your way down.
author: Jimmy Durante

quote: Be regular and orderly in your life like a bourgeois, so that you may be violent and original in your work.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Be stimulated by rejection.
author: Bob Gill

quote: Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don’t matter and those who matter don’t mind.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Beautiful accidents can happen, but accident is not the basis for design excellence. Purposeful discovery followed by focused, skillful conceptualization and execution is the basis for design excellence.
author: Andy Rutledge

quote: Beauty is the ultimate defense against complexity.
author: David Gelernter

quote: Because every person knows what he likes, every person thinks he is an expert on user interfaces.
author: Paul Heckel

quote: Before you marry a person you should first make them use a computer with slow Internet to see who they really are.
author: Will Ferrell

quote: Begin with the end in mind.
author: Lana Rigsby

quote: Behavioral design is all about feeling in control. Includes: usability, understanding, but also the feel.
author: Don Norman

quote: Being a designer is like being a porn star. You’re hot & popular for a year or two, then everyone goes off and finds something new to screw around too.
author: Jason Demetillo

quote: Being a famous designer is like being a famous dentist.
author: Noreen Morioka

quote: Being a graphic designer gets you used to rejection of your brilliance. So it’s good practice for dating.
author: Heather Phillips

quote: Being able to take ideas and transform them into something tangible is life-affirming.
author: Melinda Santillian

quote: Being good in business is the most fascinating kind of art. Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: Best thing about creating something is that it starts living it’s own life.
author: Hristo Panayotov

quote: Beta is Latin for still doesn’t work.
author: Unknown

quote: Better to be tentative than to be recklessly sure—to be an apprentice at sixty, than to present oneself as a doctor at ten.
author: Michel Eyquem de Montaigne

quote: Black holes are where God divided by zero.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Blessed is the man, who having nothing to say, abstains from giving wordy evidence of the fact.
author: George Eliot

quote: Brand identity is too often limited to personal style.
author: David A. Stuebe

quote: Broken gets fixed. Shoddy lasts forever.
author: Jack Moffet

quote: Business owners need to realize that their design is a reflection of their business even if it is not intentional. If you don’t care about your design then your design is telling people that you don’t care about your business.
author: Marco Suarez

quote: But at my back I always hear Time's winged chariot hurrying near.
author: Andrew Marvell

quote: But the web will still be full of arrogant, uninformed, polarizing, self-promoting, controversy-creating content that has ramifications no one wants to own up to. And consequently, the web will still be lacking in common courtesy, humility, and the admittance that most of us don’t know best. Which is sad, mostly because it’s true.
author: Joshua Blankenship

quote: Buy the best and you only cry once.
author: Miles Redd

quote: By far the dominant reason for not releasing sooner was a reluctance to trade the dream of success for the reality of feedback.
author: Kent Beck

quote: C is quirky, flawed, and an enormous success.
author: Unknown

quote: C makes it easy to shoot yourself in the foot; C++ makes it harder, but when you do, it blows away your whole leg.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: Call me a minimalist, call me boring and practical, whatever, but sometimes the best way to say something is with a word.
author: Justin French

quote: Calvin: You can’t just turn on creativity like a faucet. You have to be in the right mood. Hobbes: What mood is that? Calvin: Last-minute panic.
author: Calvin & Hobbes

quote: Calvin: You can’t just turn on creativity like a faucet. You have to be in the right mood.Hobbes: What mood is that?Calvin: Last-minute panic.
author: Calvin & Hobbes

quote: Chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: Chances are, unless I’m a designer, I don’t know what I want. All I know is I want something functional that looks good, is comparable with my competitors, and features constant colour schemes for branding. I’ll look at other designs that have already been created and ask for something similar. Hence, it is important that you can take the information I give and help me visualize what it is you think I want.
author: Aditya Mahesh

quote: Cheap design is like a tattoo… once you get it you’re forever branded with it.
author: Ken Peters

quote: Check your bookshelf. If it’s full of titles on HTML, CSS, and the like, instead of typography, color, and layout, you may be missing a key ingredient in the designer’s knowledge diet.
author: Jeff Croft

quote: Choosing a typeface is an act of subtlety, like casting an actor: the best person to play a gardener is somebody who looks like they might belong outdoors — not somebody who is covered in flowers and shrubbery.
author: Josh Collinsworth

quote: Chuck Norris counted to infinity... twice.
author: Unknown

quote: Chuck Norris doesn’t go hunting. Chuck Norris goes killing.
author: Unknown

quote: Client: “My wife doesn’t like it”; Designer: “Well then, I don’t like your wife”
author: Jamie Croft

quote: Clients are full of surprises. Design is what you make of the surprises.
author: Dan Phillips

quote: Clients are the difference between design and art.
author: Michael Bierut

quote: Clients don’t understand their success is reliant on standing out, not fitting in.
author: Don Draper

quote: Clients have no trouble paying $5,800 for an hour in a Gulfstream corporate jet or $425 for a month of parking. But God forbid they spend $3 per on a glossy annual report.
author: Bill Cahan

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
author: Cory House

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: Color is a creative element, not a trimming.
author: Piet Zwart

quote: Colors, like features, follow the changes of the emotions.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Colour does not add a pleasant quality to design – it reinforces it.
author: Pierre Bonnard

quote: Common sense gets a lot of credit that belongs to cold feet.
author: Arthur Godfrey

quote: Communication that doesn’t take a chance doesn’t stand a chance.
author: Carlos Segura

quote: Complaining is silly. Act or forget.
author: Stefan Stagmeister

quote: Complexity is the enemy of reliability.
author: Kyle Matthew Hansen

quote: Computer design is quite often merely bad design done on a computer.
author: Mike Hicks

quote: Computers are to design as microwaves are to cooking.
author: Milton Glaser

quote: Computers do not solve problems, they execute solutions.
author: Unknown

quote: Computers make very fast, very accurate mistakes.
author: Unknown

quote: Consistency is one of the most powerful usability principles: when things always behave the same, users don’t have to worry about what will happen. Instead, they know what will happen based on earlier experience.
author: Jakob Nielsen

quote: Content precedes design. Design in the absence of content is not design, it’s decoration.
author: Jeffrey Zeldman

quote: Copying one person is stealing. Copying ten is research.
author: Chet Atkins

quote: Copywriting is definitely the profession most written about.
author: Dave Kotler

quote: Create your own visual style… let it be unique for yourself and yet identifiable for others.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Creating something out of thin air is easy. It’s finding the air that’s hard.
author: Asher Trotter

quote: Creative thinking may mean simply the realization that there’s no particular virtue in doing things the way they have always been done.
author: Davey Coleman

quote: Creative without strategy is called “art”. Creative with strategy is called “advertising”.
author: Jef I. Richards

quote: Creativity is a drug I cannot live without.
author: Cecil B. DeMille

quote: Creativity is a habit. It’s not something that happens in the shower.
author: Nick Law

quote: Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Design is knowing which ones to keep.
author: Scott Adams

quote: Creativity is in everyone; it just manifests itself differently with each person. My CPA, for example, is one of the most creative people I know.
author: Ron Miriello

quote: Creativity is just connecting things. When you ask creative people how they did something, they feel a little guilty because they didn’t really do it, they just saw something. It seemed obvious to them after a while.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Creativity is magical, but is not magic.
author: Charles Limb

quote: Creativity is piercing the mundane to find the marvelous.
author: Bill Moyers

quote: Creativity is the greatest rebellion in existence.
author: Osho

quote: Creativity isn’t worth a thing if it isn’t served with an equal amount of reliability.
author: Anton Peck

quote: Creativity often consists of merely turning up what is already there. Did you know that right and left shoes were thought up only a little more than a century ago?
author: Bernice Fitz-Gibbon

quote: Curiosity about life in all of its aspects, I think, is still the secret of great creative people.
author: Leo Burnett

quote: Dancing is silent poetry.
author: Simonides

quote: Deal with the difficult while it is yet easy; Deal with the great while it is yet small.
author: Tao Te Ching

quote: Deal with the difficult while it is yet easy;Deal with the great while it is yet small.
author: Tao Te Ching

quote: Decisions on artwork by committee end up being made on the premise of not turning people off rather than turning people on.
author: Paul Attwood

quote: Decoration is just make-up for the wrinkles of the idea.
author: Thomas Manss

quote: Defamiliarize the ordinary.
author: Paul Rand

quote: Delay always breeds danger; and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Delete, delete, delete and at the end find the “core aspect of the design’.
author: Achille Castiglioni

quote: Descriptions are like skirts, they should be long enough to cover the subject, but short enough to keep things interesting.
author: Gidsy.com

quote: Design can have many types of soul, the key is to have one.
author: Justin Ahrens

quote: Design creates culture. Culture shapes values. Values determine the future.
author: Robert L. Peters

quote: Design for many instead of designing for money.
author: Victor Papanek

quote: Design from the spine and you’ll be fine.
author: Carl Heaton

quote: Design has become the cover for unnecessary consumption.
author: Peter Saville

quote: Design has to work, art does not.
author: Donald Judd

quote: Design in art, is a recognition of the relation between various things, various elements in the creative flux. You can’t invent a design. You recognize it, in the fourth dimension. That is, with your blood and your bones, as well as with your eyes.
author: D.H. Lawrence

quote: Design in the key to everything. If you learn how to design you can do anything.
author: Doug Cranmer

quote: Design is a formal response to a strategic question.
author: Mariona Lopez

quote: Design is a good idea.
author: Emigre

quote: Design is a mix of craft, science, storytelling, propaganda, and philosophy.
author: Erik Adigard

quote: Design is a plan for arranging elements in such a way as best to accomplish a particular purpose.
author: Charles Eames

quote: Design is a process for making things right, for shaping what people need.
author: Ralph Caplan

quote: Design is a response to a specific problem. You are given a problem to solve, and then you let the problem itself tell you what your solution is.
author: Chip Kidd

quote: Design is a solution to a problem. Art is a question to a problem.
author: John Maeda

quote: Design is about enabling ideas, processes and products: making them approachable, usable, desireable and memorable.
author: Jay Dutta

quote: Design is about making things good (and then better) and right (and fantastic) for the people who use and encounter them.
author: Matt Beale

quote: Design is an art of situations. Designers respond to a need, a problem, a circumstance, that arises in the world. The best work is produced in relation to interesting situations – an open-minded client, a good cause, or great content.
author: Ellen Lupton

quote: Design is an opportunity to continue telling the story, not just to sum everything up.
author: Tate Linden

quote: Design is as much a matter of finding problems as it is solving them.
author: Bryan Lawson

quote: Design is as much an act of spacing as an act of marking.
author: Ellen Lupton

quote: Design is choosing how you will fail.
author: Ron Fein

quote: Design is content with intent. Content without intent is noise. Intent without content is decoration.
author: Joe Sparano

quote: Design is creativity with strategy.
author: Rob Curedale

quote: Design is crucially important. We can’t have advances in technology any longer, unless design is integrated from the very start.
author: John Underkoffler

quote: Design is directed toward human beings. To design is to solve human problems by identifying them and executing the best solution.
author: Ivan Chermayeff

quote: Design is easy. All you do is stare at the screen until drops of blood form on your forehead.
author: Marty Neumeier

quote: Design is everywhere. From the dress you’re wearing to the smartphone you’re holding, it’s design.
author: Samadara Ginige

quote: Design is how you treat your customers. If you treat them well from an environmental, emotional, and aesthetic standpoint, you’re probably doing good design.
author: Yves Behar

quote: Design is in everything we make, but it’s also between those things. It’s a mix of craft, science, storytelling, propaganda, and philosophy.
author: Erik Adigard

quote: Design is intelligence made visible.
author: Alina Wheeler

quote: Design is like a mom, nobody notices when she’s around, but everybody misses her when she’s not.
author: Santiago Borray

quote: Design is more about the process than it is about the resulting prettiness.
author: Melissa Sisco

quote: Design is more of a kitchen than a knife, and more of a lab than a beaker.
author: Arman Nobari

quote: Design is more than just a few tricks to the eye. It’s a few tricks to the brain.
author: Neville Brody

quote: Design is not about innovation. Design is about communication. Innovation in design is usually a wonderful byproduct or direct result of a particular need. Design that seeks to foremost be innovative will commonly fall apart under its own stylistic girth.
author: Jason Santa Maria

quote: Design is not the narrow application of formal skills, it is a way of thinking.
author: Chris Pullman

quote: Design is redesign.
author: Jan Michl

quote: Design is so critical it should be on the agenda of every meeting in every single department.
author: Tom Peters

quote: Design is the application of intent – the opposite of happenstance, and an antidote to accident.
author: Robert L. Peters

quote: Design is the body language of your marketing. Don’t slouch.
author: Mark King

quote: Design is the conscious effort to impose a meaningful order.
author: Victor Papanek

quote: Design is the contrast of the core of limitations therefore there are no boundaries. It is simply an interpretation of creativity.
author: Jenaiha Woods

quote: Design is the fundamental soul of a human-made creation that ends up expressing itself in successive outer layers of the product or service.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Design is the method of putting form and content together. Design, just as art, has multiple definitions; there is no single definition. Design can be art. Design can be aesthetics. Design is so simple, that’s why it is so complicated.
author: Paul Rand

quote: Design is the search for a magical balance between business and art; art and craft; intuition and reason; concept and detail; playfulness and formality; client and designer; designer and printer; and printer and public.
author: Valerie Pettis

quote: Design is the silent ambassador of your brand.
author: Paul Rand

quote: Design is thinking made visual.
author: Saul Bass

quote: Design is to invent with intent. If you take away the “invent’ bit, you have an engineer. If you take away the “intent’ bit, you have an artist.
author: Rebecca Reubens

quote: Design is where science and art break even.
author: Robin Mathew

quote: Design must be functional and functionality must be translated into visual aesthetics, without any reliance on gimmicks that have to be explained.
author: Ferdinand A. Porsche

quote: Design should never be ridden with GGE’s (gratuitous graphic elements).
author: Nadine Buckley

quote: Design should never say, “Look at me.” It should always say, “Look at this.”
author: David Craib

quote: Design to communicate, not just decorate.
author: Tony Stanton

quote: Design to express, not to impress.
author: John Tanedo

quote: Design trends online change more often than the wind, and slightly less often than my socks.
author: Suleiman Leadbitter

quote: Design works best when it gets out of the user’s way.
author: Neil Gajera

quote: Design, in its broadest sense, is the enabler of the digital era – it’s a process that creates order out of chaos, that renders technology usable to business. Design means being good, not just looking good.
author: Clement Mok

quote: Designers are crazy and yet sane enough to know where to draw the line.
author: Benjamin Valbret

quote: Designers are meant to be loved, not to be understood.
author: Fabien Barral

quote: Designers can create normalcy out of chaos; they can clearly communicate ideas through the organising and manipulating of words and pictures.
author: Jeffrey Veen

quote: Designers deal in ideas. They give shape to ideas that shape our world, enrich everyday experiences, and improve our lives. Where there’s confusion, designers fashion clarity; where there’s chaos, designers construct order; where there’s entropy, designers promote vitality; where there’s indifference, designers swell passion; where there’s mediocrity, designers imbue excellence; and where there’s silence, designers lend voice.
author: Ken Peters

quote: Designers don’t actually solve problems. They work through them.
author: Marty Neumeier

quote: Designers have a dual duty; contractually to their clients and morally to the later users and recipients of their work.
author: Hans Höger

quote: Designers must be stewards of design rather than dictators.
author: Cassie McDaniel

quote: Designers shooting for usable is like a chef shooting for edible.
author: Aarron Walter

quote: Designers tend to overvalue differentiation and originality. We are taught this in design school. The best solutions are created ex nihilo, break new ground, resemble nothing else in the world. Everyone wants to stand out, or else what’s the point? But this isn’t true. Most people don’t want to stand out. They want to fit in. More precisely, they want to fit in with the people they like, or want to be like.
author: Michael Bierut

quote: Designers tend to whisper, ad agencies tend to shout.
author: David Stuart

quote: Designers think everything done by someone else is awful, and that they could do it better themselves, which explains why I designed my own living room carpet, I suppose.
author: Chris Bangle

quote: Designing for clients that don’t appreciate the value of design is like buying new tires for a rental car.
author: Joel Fisher

quote: Designing something is like having a baby. Asking me to try another design once I’ve birthed something amazing is like asking me to put the baby back in the womb and try again. That never works out for anyone.
author: Chad McMillan

quote: Designing with watermarked photos is like baking with fake sugar.
author: Justin Giovanetti

quote: Developer: an organism that turns coffee into code.
author: Unknown

quote: Did you know? The collective noun for a group of programmers is a merge-conflict.
author: Unknown

quote: Discontentment and reiteration are vital to good design.
author: Sammuel Nevarez

quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Do not seek to change what has come before. Seek to create that which has not.
author: David Airey

quote: Do right.
author: Jeffrey Brown

quote: Do we really need a simple definition of design or should we accept that design is too complex a matter to be summarized in less than a book?
author: Bryan Lawson

quote: Do what I want, not what I say.
author: Brian Fritzpatick

quote: Do what you love and tomorrow will pay the rent.
author: Felix Sockwell

quote: Do you think advertisement can sell if nobody can read it? You cannot save souls in an empty church.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: Do you validate other people’s markup? Yes? You’re an asshole.
author: Jeff Croft

quote: Do, or do not. There is no “try”.
author: Yoda

quote: Don't make the user provide information that the system already knows.
author: Rick Lemons

quote: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.
author: George Burns

quote: Done is beautiful.
author: Frank Chimero

quote: Don’t ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive and go do it.
author: Howard Thurman

quote: Don’t design for everyone. It’s impossible. All you end up doing is designing something that makes everyone unhappy.
author: Leisa Reichelt

quote: Don’t explain why it works; explain how you use it.
author: Steven Brust

quote: Don’t let the truth get in the way of a good story.
author: Unknown

quote: Don’t let your design resist your readers. Don’t let it stand in the way of what they want to do: read.
author: Steve Krug

quote: Don’t make me think.
author: Steve Krug

quote: Don’t make something unless it is both necessary and useful; but if it is both necessary and useful, don’t hesitate to make it beautiful.
author: Shaker Philosophy

quote: Don’t mistake legibility for communication.
author: David Carson

quote: Don’t spend too much time planning, release early and often, some things will work, others won’t, refine and move forward and above all forget the money, just make sure you love what you’re doing.
author: Kevin Rose

quote: Don’t stare at a blank page for too long, be bold, and make the first incisive stroke. The rest will come naturally.
author: James Kingman

quote: Don’t think.
author: William Firebrace

quote: Don’t try and reinvent the wheel – just work on making it better than anyone else.
author: David A. Stuebe

quote: Don’t try to be original try to be good.
author: Paul Rand

quote: Don’t worry about people stealing an idea. If it’s original, you will have to ram it down their throats.
author: Howard Aiken

quote: Don’t worry about people stealing your design work. Worry about the day they stop.
author: Jeffrey Zeldman

quote: Don’t you miss doing creative stuff, as an engineer? Don’t you miss the creativity of the art world? You can say: I’m working on an infinite canvas capable of any size and shape, that’s already glowing every color possible into the eyes of just about everyone on the planet. And I get to decide the kind of experience, feeling, and emotion they are going to have. How is that not creative?
author: Natalya Shelburne

quote: Draw lines, young man, many lines; from memory or from nature – it is in this way you will become a good artist. (said to Edgar Degas)
author: Jean Auguste Dominique Ingres

quote: Drawing is speaking to the eye; talking is painting to the ear.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Each problem that I solved became a rule which served afterwards to solve other problems.
author: Rene Descartes

quote: Easy is not to be underestimated. Easy taps the pool of talent and ideas out there that were turned off by hard.
author: Chris Anderson

quote: Education is not the answer to the question. Education is the means to the answer to all questions.
author: William Allin

quote: Elegance is not the abundance of simplicity. It is the absence of complexity.
author: Alex White

quote: Eloquence is vehement simplicity.
author: Richard Cecil

quote: Embrace change or become a Design-O-Saur.
author: Von Glitschka

quote: Even large companies need small logos.
author: Tanner Christensen

quote: Even the best planning is not so omniscient as to get it right the first time.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: Every act of creation is first an act of destruction.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Every big computing disaster has come from taking too many ideas and putting them in one place.
author: Gordon Bell

quote: Every child is an artist. The challenge is to remain an artist after you grow up.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Every designers’ dirty little secret is that they copy other designers’ work. They see work they like, and they imitate it. Rather cheekily, they call this inspiration.
author: Aaron Russell

quote: Every generation laughs at the old fashions, but follows religiously the new.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Every good work of software starts by scratching a developer´s personal itch.
author: Unknown

quote: Every great design begins with an even better story.
author: Lorinda Mamo

quote: Every new thing you make will be (should be) the nicest thing you’ve made so far, because you’re learning and getting better with each and every new project.
author: Jessica Hische

quote: Every night I pray that clients with taste will get money and clients with money will get taste.
author: Bill Gardner

quote: Every picture owes more to other pictures painted before than it owes to nature.
author: E.H. Gombrich

quote: Every piece of software written today is likely going to infringe on someone else’s patent.
author: Miguel de Icaza

quote: Every practice has a set of rules which governs it. Mastery occurs with the realization of these rules. Innovation occurs at the point of intelligent and creative rebellion against them.
author: Fiel Valdez

quote: Everybody in advertising is blonde, beautiful, families are happy, care are never in traffic, everything is shiny, food looks like it’s incredibly taseful. I ask myself, “How stupid are we?”
author: Oliveiro Toscani

quote: Everybody is a user experience designer.
author: Whitney Hess

quote: Everybody pities the weak; jealousy you have to earn.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: Everybody’s a web designer until, you know, they actually try to do it.
author: Gabe Boning

quote: Everyone gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Everyone has a plan until they get punched in the face.
author: Mike Tyson

quote: Everyone is an artist.
author: Joseph Beuys

quote: Everything is designed. Few things are designed well.
author: Brian Reed

quote: Everything is possible, that’s what science is all about. No, that’s what’s being a Magical Elf is all about.
author: The Professor (on Futurama)

quote: Everything that can be said, can be said clearly.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Everything was just a wild guess. And it takes a while to get confident that you’re guessing pretty good.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: Everything we do communicates.
author: Pete Episcopo

quote: Excellence is not a skill, it is an attitude.
author: Ralph Marston

quote: Experience has shown that our best customers are ones who have as much respect for our time as we have for theirs.
author: Alex King

quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Experts are rarely insulted by something that is clear enough for beginners. Everybody appreciates clarity.
author: Steve Krug

quote: Facts are the enemy of truth.
author: Don Quixote 'Man of La Mancha'

quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Fast, Good, Cheap. Pick two.
author: Unknown

quote: Features are like having sex.You make one mistake and you have to support it for life.
author: Dave McClure

quote: Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social environment. Most people are even incapable of forming such opinions.
author: Bradford Sherrill

quote: Find something you’re passionate about and keep tremendously interested in it.
author: Julia Child

quote: Find the simple story in the product, and present it in an articulate and intelligent, persuasive way.
author: Bill Bernbach

quote: Fire the committee. No great website in history has been conceived of by more than three people. Not one. This is a dealbreaker.
author: Seth Godin

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: Five years ago, the heroes were technologists. Today, the heroes are designers building out a user experience. You can have the most amazing technology in the world, but if it’s not put in a form that’s useful and desirable, you won’t be successful.
author: Robert Brunner

quote: Fix the cause, not the symptom.
author: Steve Maguire

quote: Focus is saying no to 1000 good ideas.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Focus on WHY instead of WHAT in your code will make you a better developer.
author: Jordi Boggiano

quote: For every new feature we add, we take an old one out. A lot of big sites don’t do that, and it’s a problem. Twitter started as a beautifully simple product, but it’s now going the same route as Facebook. The drive to innovate can overencumber and destroy a product.
author: David Karp

quote: For me, design is like choosing what I’m going to wear for the day – only much more complicated and not really the same at all.
author: Robynne Raye

quote: For me, discomfort is a signal of an exceptional concept. When I’m totally comfortable with a concept, I’ve probably used it fore or seen it somewhere else. Discomfort is almost a prerequisite for a great idea.
author: Craig Frazier

quote: For those who would argue that it’s impossible to evaluate designs without real content, let me ask this: why then, is it okay to evaluate content out of context of the designs?
author: Karen McGrane

quote: For web designers, there are four keys to surviving bad economic times: do good work, charge a fair price, lower your overhead, and be sure you are communicating with your client.
author: Jeffrey Zeldman

quote: Form follows function – that has been misunderstood. Form and function should be one, joined in a spiritual union.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Form follows function.
author: Louis Sullivan

quote: Functionality is so over-valued in design, and we’ve kept design very small in that way. Functionality is the sheer minimum. If your house burns down, what do you take? The cat in the window that you got from your mother, or the chair you have?
author: Marcel Wanders

quote: Genius is 1% inspiration and 99% perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Geometry can produce legible letters, but art alone makes the beautiful. Art begins where geometry ends, and imparts to letters a character transcending mere measurement.
author: Paul Standard

quote: Get in over your head as often and as joyfully as possible.
author: Alexander Isley

quote: Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Getting addicted to design is bad for design.
author: Andy Altmann

quote: Give a crap. Don’t give a fuck.
author: Karen McGrane

quote: Give me a museum and I'll fill it.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Give me chastity and continence, but not yet.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: God is a comedian playing to an audience too afraid to laugh.
author: Voltaire

quote: God is real, unless declared integer.
author: Unknown

quote: God, grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Good Design: 1. Fulfills its function. 2. Respects its materials. 3. Is suited to method of production. 4. Combines these in imaginative expression.
author: Eliot Noyes

quote: Good Design:1. Fulfills its function.2. Respects its materials.3. Is suited to method of production.4. Combines these in imaginative expression.
author: Eliot Noyes

quote: Good art inspires; Good design motivates.
author: Otl Aicher

quote: Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee, and just as hard to sleep after.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Good design at the front-end suggests that everything is in order at the back-end, whether or not that is the case.
author: Dmitry Fadeyev

quote: Good design begins with honesty, asks tough questions, comes from collaboration and from trusting your intuition.
author: Freeman Thomas

quote: Good design goes to heaven; bad design goes everywhere.
author: Mieke Gerritzen

quote: Good design is a lot like clear thinking made visual.
author: Edward Tufte

quote: Good design is all about making other designers feel like idiots because that idea wasn’t theirs.
author: Frank Chimero

quote: Good design is finding a solution to a problem. Great design is finding the simplest solution to the same problem.
author: Nicholas Petersen

quote: Good design is good business.
author: Thomas Watson, Jr.

quote: Good design is in all the things you notice. Great design is in all the things you don’t.
author: Wim Hovens

quote: Good design is obvious. Great design is transparent.
author: Joe Sparano

quote: Good design is partially creativity and innovation, but primarily knowledge and awareness.
author: Chuck Green

quote: Good design keeps the user happy, the manufacturer in the black and the aesthete unoffended.
author: Raymond Loewy

quote: Good design means never having to say “Click Here.”
author: Shawn Leslie

quote: Good design must be defined by appropriateness to audience and goals, and by its effectiveness, not by its adherence to Swiss design or the number of awards it wins.
author: Drew Davies

quote: Good designers are praised for their technique, great designers for their impact.
author: Tate Linden

quote: Good designers copy; great designers steal.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Good designs come from the heart, not from the brain.
author: Danny Sengers

quote: Good ideas never go out of style.
author: Dale Harris

quote: Good ideas rarely come in bunches. The designer who voluntarily presents his client with a batch of layouts does so not out prolificacy, but out of uncertainty or fear.
author: Paul Rand

quote: Good ideas turn into good designs fairly quickly. If you catch yourself fiddling too much with colors, borders and treatments to bring a design together, chances are the problem lies somewhere deeper.
author: Ryan Singer

quote: Good is the enemy of great, but great is the enemy of shipped.
author: Jeffrey Zeldman

quote: Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the laws.
author: Plato

quote: Good, fast, or cheap… pick two.
author: Old Adage

quote: Google has the functionality of a really complicated Swiss Army knife, but the home page is our way of approaching it closed. It’s simple, it’s elegant, you can slip it in your pocket, but it’s got the great doodad when you need it. A lot of our competitors are like a Swiss Army knife open – and that can be intimidating and occasionally harmful.
author: Marissa Mayer

quote: Graphic Designers are idea embalmers, loving undertakers preserving bits of data like so many butterflies pinned to felt in a jewel box.
author: Paul Saffo

quote: Graphic design has been likened to a wine glass. When we drink wine we barely notice the glass it’s served in. It wouldn’t be true to say that we don’t care what glass we drink out of – we wouldn’t choose to drink a rare vintage out of a Tupperware mug, for example – but it’s the wine that matters, not the vessel it comes in.
author: Adrian Shaughnessy

quote: Graphic design is building systems.
author: Michael Stinson

quote: Graphic design is the design of highly disposable items… It all winds up in the garbage.
author: Karrie Jacobs

quote: Graphic design is the paradise of individuality, eccentricity, heresy, abnormality, hobbies and humours.
author: George Santayana

quote: Graphic design is the paradise of individuality, eccentricity, heresy, abnormality, hobbies, and humors.
author: George Santayana

quote: Graphic design will save the world right after rock and roll does.
author: David Carson

quote: Graphic designers are, by and large, selfish and spoiled. They stubbornly control and individually design things that a generally smaller than them, perfecting to a level appreciated only by people like them. They don’t share and play well with others.
author: Wayne Hunt

quote: Graphic designers find themselves in a role of visual dishwashers for the Information Architects’ chefs.
author: Gunnar Swanson

quote: Great design is eliminating all unnecessary details.
author: Minh D. Tran

quote: Great designers seldom make great advertising men, because they get overcome by the beauty of the picture – and forget that merchandise must be sold.
author: James Randolph Adams

quote: Great ideas can be found in every leaf, in every tree, in every blade of grass. Oh, no, wait… I was thinking of chlorophyll.
author: Jim Olen

quote: Great ideas, like babies, are often conceived after a few glasses of wine.
author: Sharon Moore

quote: Great stories happen to people who can tell them.
author: Ira Glass

quote: Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: Guns don’t kill people. Chuck Norris kills people.
author: Unknown

quote: Hackers don’t need idea people when they are the idea people.
author: Marc Grabanski

quote: Half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don’t know which half.
author: John Wanamaker

quote: Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Junior

quote: Have no fear of perfection – you’ll never reach it.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Having a favourite colour is like having a favourite lung.
author: Sara Genn

quote: Having a style is like being in jail.
author: Anthon Beeke

quote: Having small touches of colour makes it more colourful than having the whole thing in colour.
author: Dieter Rams

quote: He is one of those people who would be enormously improved by death.
author: H. H. Munro

quote: He who cannot draw on three thousand years is living from hand to mouth.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: He who has a 'why' to live, can bear with almost any 'how'.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Hello, PHP, my old friend.
author: Anna Debenham

quote: Helvetica is like a really good friend. You go off and hang with the other fonts (the artsy, grungy, trendy, thin, fat, tall, scripty types) and even use them a little, but helvetica is always there. A nice stable friend.
author: Andrew Frigo

quote: Her complexity is a glorious fire that consumes, while her simplicity goes unapproachable. But if one takes time to understand her, there is something beautiful to find, something simple to be loved. But she goes unloved, for being misunderstood.
author: Anthony Liccione

quote: Here is one of the few effective keys to the design problem — the ability of the designer to recognize as many of the constraints as possible — his willingness and enthusiasm for working within these constraints. Constraints of price, of size, of strength, of balance, of surface, of time and so forth.
author: Charles Eames

quote: Here’s how we work. Somebody calls up with a project; we do some stuff; and the money follows.
author: Tim Brennan

quote: Here’s the world’s worst idea for a movie: Titanic. It did okay at the box office.
author: Scott Adams

quote: Hey! It compiles! Ship it!
author: Unknown

quote: High degrees of specialization may be rendering us unable to see the connections between the things we design and their consequences as they ripple out into the biosphere.
author: Terry Irwin

quote: His ignorance is encyclopedic.
author: Abba Eban

quote: History has remembered the kings and warriors, because they destroyed; art has remembered the people, because they created.
author: William Morris

quote: Honesty is the best policy, unless you work in advertising.
author: Jenn Loots

quote: How can there be too many typefaces in the world? Are there too many songs, too many books, too many places to go?
author: Rian Hughes

quote: How well we communicate is determined not by how well we say things, but how well we are understood.
author: Andrew Grove

quote: How wrong it is for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself.
author: Anais Nin

quote: However beautiful the strategy, you should occasionally look at the results.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: However, I’ve always been more concerned with users. Programmers do their work but once, while users are saddled with it ever thereafter.
author: Jef Raskin

quote: Human history becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: I In fact choose to use a coffeemaker to boil vegetables. Why? Because if I used something else that just makes coffee, my client would ask me “Can it boil vegetables?”
author: Joel Fisher

quote: I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: I am always driven by the terror of humiliation.
author: Judd Apatow

quote: I am ready to meet my Maker. Whether my Maker is prepared for the great ordeal of meeting me is another matter.
author: Sir Winston Churchill

quote: I am.
author: Robert Brownjohn (when asked What is graphic design?)

quote: I became a graphic artist because of the tools. I love working at a big drawing table with traditional tools: T-squares, compasses, mechanical pencils, French curves, blank ink, and graphite. At a computer, one works on a keyboard. I never considered myself a typist.
author: Michael Schwab

quote: I begin by taking. I shall find scholars later to demonstrate my perfect right.
author: Frederick (II) the Great

quote: I believe that a good user interface is carefully targeted towards its audience, with the right mixture of simplicity, elegance and innovation.
author: Robert Peloschek

quote: I blame television and movies, especially cop shows. “Can you improve the resolution on that face?” “Sure, let me just pull some information that was never captured out of my ass.”
author: Rod Knowlton

quote: I can always find love, but eventually I get horny for my creativity.
author: Gilda Radner

quote: I can never stand still. I must explore and experiment. I am never satisfied with my work. I resent the limitations of my own imagination.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I can think of nothing worse than becoming really popular, being all the rage.
author: Rem Koolhaas

quote: I can write better than anybody who can write faster, and I can write faster than anybody who can write better.
author: A. J. Liebling

quote: I didn’t get into design to be an artist. To me, an artist creates things to evoke emotion. Being a designer goes a step further than that, not only trying to evoke emotion but trying to make a reaction. It is very objective-driven, and that’s what makes it interesting.
author: Mike Davidson

quote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: I don’t care if you like it! I want to know if you understand it.
author: JP Arevalo

quote: I don’t care if you’re a billionaire. If you haven’t started a company, really gambled your resume and your money and maybe even your marriage to just go crazy and try something on your own, you’re no pirate and you aren’t in the club.
author: Michael Arrington

quote: I don’t know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: I don’t read inspiring books. I find that such books give me a temporal high, but they don’t give me the power to actually follow through. In fact, I suspect these books often serve as a substitute for actual success, rather than as a way of helping people achieve success. By reading inspiring books, you can experience success vicariously; they free you from having to achieve things yourself.
author: Lukas Mathis

quote: I don’t think of myself as an artist. I know some designers consider themselves such, but I can’t. This is not to say that I don’t hope that our work has artistic merit. Anyway, I never know how someone could proclaim himself or herself to be an “artist’; I think it should be a designation best left for others to bestow, much like “genius’ and “asshole’.
author: Alexander Isley

quote: I don’t think that all people read in the same way. Today, entire generations are growing up watching MTV and playing video games and it is safe to assume that these people have a high degree of visual sophistication. and are not easily discouraged by a lens straightforward or ambiguous typography. On the contrary, they are attracted and enticed to read something because of visual richness.
author: Ruby Vanderlans

quote: I don’t think that design needs theory, but I think designers need theory.
author: Johanna Drucker

quote: I don’t want something special. I want something beautifully plain.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: I fill up a place, which may be better… when I have made it empty.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I find going to bed and pulling my imagination over my head often means waking up with a solution to a design problem. That state of limbo, the time between sleeping and waking, seems to allow ideas to somehow outflank the sentinels of common sense. That’s when they can float to the surface. I find ideas often show up in the shower, or while I’m contemplating marmalade and toast and breakfast.
author: Alan Fletcher

quote: I find modernist design boring, but it so much faster!
author: Christine Suewon Lee

quote: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: I find that when someone’s taking time to do something right in the present, they’re a perfectionist with no ability to prioritize, whereas when someone took time to do something right in the past, they’re a master artisan of great foresight.
author: Randall Munroe

quote: I for one absolutely and unequivocally refuse to be bullied about by a thing’s capacity to absorb light. There is nothing less appealing than a color fraught with meaning – the very notion is boisterous, inappropriate, and marked by the dreariest sort of longing.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn’t say any other way – things I had no words for.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quote: I go to work every morning with the possibility that I might learn something I don’t already know… You should look at every problem and think, “what can I learn by doing this?’ And if you think you can learn nothing, forget about doing it.
author: Milton Glaser

quote: I have NOT lost my mind—I have it backed up on tape somewhere.
author: Unknown

quote: I have always railed against ideological purity, or any other kind. Corruption is more interesting than purity.
author: Milton Glaser

quote: I have come to believe that the whole world is an enigma, a harmless enigma that is made terrible by our own mad attempt to interpret it as though it had an underlying truth.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: I have found the best people to work with are gay men. They never have to “run it past their wives.’
author: Rodney Davidson

quote: I have never killed anyone, but I have read some obituary notices with great satisfaction.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I have no data yet. It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data. Insensibly one begins to twist facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts.
author: Sherlock Holmes

quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Alba Edison

quote: I have nothing to declare except my genius.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I have thought about the nature of this creative process and have reached a somewhat aberrant conclusion. I don’t understand it and I don’t think anyone else does either.
author: William Beck

quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
author: Confucius

quote: I just invent, then wait until man comes around to needing what I´ve invented.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

quote: I just worked hard and tried to make my thing better.
author: Jesse Thorn

quote: I know the price of success: dedication, hard work & an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: I like jumping back and forth between a few different things to let my subconscious chew on one problem while my conscious works on something else.
author: Loren Brichter

quote: I like my ARTSY with a little bit of FARTSY.
author: Marc Johns

quote: I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, It’s a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope. Which is what I do, and that enables you to laugh at life’s realities.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: I loathe the phrase “no questions asked.” Great service is about communication, sincerity, and action – not blind automation.
author: Marshall Bonobos

quote: I look for three things in a project: 1) Compelling work; 2) fun client; 3) astronomical fees. However, to have a successful project, I really only need two out of three. For example, I’ll do great work with fun people for nothing and still feel rewarded. Or, I’ll do great work for a mean, stupid client for outrageous money. Or, I’ll do boring work with somebody I like a lot for more money than one can imagine. Anytime I’m faced with only one of the three it’s time to rethink the relationship. Actually, it’s time to move on.
author: Lowell Williams

quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they go by.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: I love designing, it is something which permeates my whole living, whether it is simply choosing the colour of my clothes in the morning or organising my household. Design to me is akin to beauty, an externalisation of my inner process regarding beauty & contentment with life.
author: Martine Moeykens

quote: I love making the stuff, that’s sort of the core of it. I love creating the stuff. It’s so satisfying to get from the beginning to the end, from a shaky nothing idea to something that’s well formed and the audience really likes. It’s like a drug: You keep trying to do it again and again and again. I’ve learned from experience that if you work harder at it, and apply more energy and time to it, and more consistency, you get a better result. It comes from the work.
author: Louis C.K.

quote: I love the comment, “You must love designing for a living.” At that point I usually start to laugh or break into uncontrollable tears.
author: Andrew Lewis

quote: I make all my decisions on intuition. But then, I must know why I made that decision. I throw a spear into the darkness. That is intuition. Then I must send an army into the darkness to find the spear. That is intellect.
author: Ingmar Bergman

quote: I make solutions nobody wants to problems that don’t exist.
author: Alvin Lustig

quote: I mean there’s a fun in being hated, it puts a fire in your ass and it gets fucking boring to be loved by everyone.
author: James Hetfield

quote: I met with a potential client today and part of their opening gambit was how they were looking for revolutionary work delivered within a tight timescale, and if the work could be done a reduced rate then they’d be able to send a load more work our way. They were saying that they wanted work that was fast, good, and cheap. And if the work was fast, good, and cheap enough, the reward would be the offer of more work that is fast, good, and cheap. Let me be clear about this, these people are evil, and their work is poison.
author: Hoss Gifford

quote: I never let my schooling get in the way of my education.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I only believe in statistics that I doctored myself.
author: Winston S. Churchill?

quote: I rarely agree with what clients ask me to do.
author: Ross Lovegrove

quote: I really like looking at design and thinking: that attention to detail must have taken absolutely ages.
author: Si Scott

quote: I recently saw another demonstration of graphic design’s ubiquity. Someone had taken a series of photographs of busy streets and then painstakingly removed all the logos, symbols, signs, colours, street names and road markings. In other words, they had removed all the graphic design from these photographs. The results were staggering. A world without graphic design is an unrecognizable world — more alien than all but the most extreme sci-fi imaginings.
author: Adrian Shaughnessy

quote: I say that flat is the new black; that 2D is the new avant-garde; that a surface doesn’t have to be ashamed of being a surface. Technology users of the world, unite: you have nothing to lose but your bas-relief buttons. Let us march forwards together, spurning chrome, into a cleaner, lighter future.
author: Steven Poole

quote: I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them.
author: Ian L. Fleming

quote: I shall sing that first line twice, and perhaps if I sing it very quickly, I shall find myself singing the third and fourth lines before I have time to think of them, and that will be a Good Song.
author: Winnie The Pooh

quote: I think 'Hail to the Chief' has a nice ring to it.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: I think advertising is a brilliant concept that has been pooped upon by selfish marketers, resulting in corrupted motives and flawed execution.
author: Michael Mistretta

quote: I think design covers so much more than the aesthetic. Design is fundamentally more. Design is usability. It is Information Architecture. It is Accessibility. This is all design.
author: Mark Boulton

quote: I think design would be better if designers were much more skeptical about its applications. If you believe in the potency of your craft, where you choose to dole it out is not something to take lightly.
author: Frank Chimero

quote: I think designers who aren’t selfish do really awful work.
author: Paul Sahre

quote: I think if you’re starting out early in the process by talking about your ideas for solutions, you’re already not listening. I think you need to enter into any design project with that zen learner’s mind of “I don’t know what I don’t know.’
author: Kim Goodwin

quote: I think most programmers spend the first 5 years of their career mastering complexity, and the rest of their lives learning simplicity.
author: Buzz Andersen

quote: I think there are two types of people in this world – people who can start things and people who can finish things. And while I place great value on the finishers, it’s the starters who are rare because they can envision what isn’t there.
author: Ed Frank

quote: I think we agree, the past is over.
author: George W. Bush

quote: I think what I feel fortunate about is that I am still astonished – that things still amaze me. And I think that that’s a great benefit of being in the arts, where the possibility for learning never disappears; where you basically have to admit you never learn it.
author: Milton Glaser

quote: I try and be as stupid as possible regarding my profession, which means I try to look at as few design magazines as possible.
author: Ettore Sottsass

quote: I try not to think out of the box anymore, but on its edge, its corner, its flap, and under its bar code.
author: Clint Runge

quote: I try to take my camera everywhere with me so that I’ll be ready when unicorns crapping rainbows come flying in from the heavens.
author: Robert Otani

quote: I want everything we do to be beautiful. I don’t give a damn whether the client understands that that’s worth anything, or that the client thinks it’s worth anything, or whether it is worth anything. It’s worth it to me. It’s the way I want to live my life. I want to make beautiful things, even if nobody cares.
author: Saul Bass

quote: I want to risk hitting my head on the ceiling of my talent. I want to really test it out and say: O.K., you’re not that good. You just reached the level here. I don’t ever want to fail, but I want to risk failure every time out of the gate.
author: Quentin Tarantino

quote: I warn you against believing that advertising is a science.
author: Bill Bernbach

quote: I was gonna get a candy bar; the button I was supposed to push was “HH”, so I went to the side, I found the “H” button, I pushed it twice. Fuckin’…potato chips came out, man, because they had an “HH” button for Christ’s sake! You need to let me know. I’m not familiar with the concept of “HH”. I did not learn my AA-BB-CC’s. God god, dammit dammit.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: I would say my biggest pet peeve related to the industry would be people focusing on technology instead of design, standards instead of users, and validation rather than innovation. Web standards and best practices are noble goals, but all too often in our community people forget they are a means to an end, not the end itself.
author: Jeff Croft

quote: I would show my jobs to my mother, and she would always say the same thing: “That’s nice dear.” And then she would say, “Did you write it?” or “Did you do the drawing?” or “Did you take the pictures?” I’d always answer “no,” then I realized the problem. My answer was then, “I made this happen. It’s called design.”
author: Brian Webb

quote: I'm all in favor of keeping dangerous weapons out of the hands of fools. Let's start with typewriters.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: I'm living so far beyond my income that we may almost be said to be living apart.
author: e e cummings

quote: I've had a wonderful time, but this wasn't it.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: IDEA BY SELF IS COLD. JUST SIT THERE. DO NOTHING. IF WANT DO SOMETHING, NEED FIRE.
author: FAKEGRIMLOCK

quote: IF YOU MAKE EVERYTHING BOLD, NOTHING IS BOLD.
author: Art Webb

quote: Ideas are worthless. Execution is everything.
author: Scott Adams

quote: Ideas trump aesthetics. Convenience trumps UI. Content trumps platforms.
author: Marc-Oliver Gern

quote: Ideas want to be ugly.
author: Jason Santa Maria

quote: If Ernest Hemingway, James Mitchener, Neil Simon, Frank Lloyd Wright, and Pablo Picasso could not get it right the first time, what makes you think that you will?
author: Paul Heckel

quote: If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: If I do my job well, the identity program will also clean up the image of the company, position it as being contemporary and keep it from ever looking dated.
author: Saul Bass

quote: If I forget the words, they weren’t very memorable in the first place.
author: Willie Nelson
