quote: To create anything–whether a short story or a magazine profile or a film or a sitcom–is to believe, if only momentarily, you are capable of magic.
author: Tom Bissel

quote: To create great work, here’s how you must spend your time: 1% Inspiration 9% Perspiration 90% Justification.
author: George Lois

quote: To dismiss front-end design as mere “icing’ is to jeopardize the success of any site.
author: Curt Cloninger

quote: To envision what will be, you must remove yourself from the constant concern for what already is.
author: Scott Belsky

quote: To err is human, but for a real disaster you need a computer.
author: Unknown

quote: To ignore social media would be like early man ignoring fire.
author: Barry Roos

quote: To make pearls, you’ve got to eat dirt.
author: Frank Chimero

quote: To push the boundaries, you need to know where the edges are.
author: Mark Boulton

quote: To say a grid is limiting is to say that language is limiting, or typography is limiting.
author: Ellen Lupton

quote: To see takes time.
author: Georgia O’Keeffe

quote: To some degree, to be creative you have to be selfish.
author: Meredith Norwood

quote: Today’s designers and illustrators are synthesizing the best elements from past eras of graphic design to create a new visual language with a reduced and rational approach.
author: R. Klanten, H. Hellige

quote: Too often, look and feel, color scheme, layout, and identity are presented as solutions to problems discussed in these conversations long before regard is given to other less-aesthetic issues that may very well be the root of the problem. The old warning against treating symptom rather than cause comes to mind.
author: Cameron Moll

quote: Traditional marketing is often seeing is getting people to do things but I think web marketing is about helping people do things.
author: Gerry McGovern

quote: Translation is not a matter of words only: it is a matter of making intelligible a whole culture.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: Truly elegant design incorporates top-notch functionality into a simple, uncluttered form.
author: David Lewis

quote: Try to learn something about everything and everything about something.
author: Thomas Henry Huxley

quote: Turning away bad clients can leave you feeling oddly guilty. They’re sort of like alcoholic or meth head cousins who force you, by their own bad behavior into denying them things you wouldn’t deny other people. You’re left feeling not quite yourself.
author: Carolyn Wood

quote: Type is a beautiful group of letters, not a group of beautiful letters.
author: Matthew Carter

quote: Typography at its best is a visual form of language linking timelessness and time.
author: Robert Bringhurst

quote: Typography has one plain duty before it and that is to convey information in writing. No argument or consideration can absolve typography from this duty.
author: Emil Ruder

quote: Typography is a beautiful group of letters, not a group of beautiful letters.
author: Steve Byers

quote: UNIX is the answer, but only if you phrase the question very carefully.
author: Unknown

quote: Ubuntu is an ancient African word, meaning “can’t configure Debian”
author: Unknown

quote: Unsolicited redesigns are terrific and fun and useful, and I hope designers never stop doing them. But as they do so, I also hope they remember it helps no one – least of all the author of the redesign – to assume the worst about the original source and the people who work hard to maintain and improve it, even though those efforts may seem imperfect from the outside.
author: Khoi Vinh

quote: Urban public space is a stage for viewing the field of graphic design in its diversity. A mix of voices, from advertising to activism, compete for visibility.
author: Ellen Lupton

quote: Usage is like oxygen for ideas.
author: Matt Mullenweg

quote: Use two typeface families maximum. OK, maybe three.
author: Timothy Samara

quote: Usenet is a Mobius strand of spaghetti.
author: Unknown

quote: Users will tell you what they think they want. Users will tell you what they think you want to hear. Users will tell you what they think sounds good. Users will not tell you what you need to know. You have to watch them to discover that.
author: Adam Judge

quote: Using a watermark on your work is like peeing on your belongings so no one will steal them.
author: Thomas Amador

quote: Using simpler forms and straightforward, easy-to-use instruments and controls allows you to achieve a very high level of craftsmanship. We then use color and texture to create a personality for each vehicle.
author: Larry Erickson

quote: Verbalizing design is another act of design.
author: Kenya Hara

quote: Visual design is often the polar opposite of engineering: trading hard edges for subjective decisions based on gut feelings and personal experiences. It’s messy, unpredictable, and notoriously hard to measure. The apparently erratic behavior of artists drives engineers bananas. Their decisions seem arbitrary and risk everything with no guaranteed benefit.
author: Scott Stevenson

quote: Visualization without Design is merely a dream. Design without Visualization just passes the time.
author: Sonal Nayyar

quote: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V Berard

quote: Watch what people are cynical about, and one can often discover what they lack.
author: George Patton

quote: We adore chaos because we love to produce order.
author: M.C. Escher

quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: We are all designers, the difference is that only a few of us do it full-time.
author: Sabo Tercero

quote: We are interpreters – not merely translators between sender and receiver. What we say and how we say it makes a difference. If we want to speak to people, we need to know their language. In order to design for understanding, we need to understand design.
author: Erik Spiekermann

quote: We are not artists or poets. We are artisans and craftsmen. Our products solve problems. They do not hang on museum walls.
author: Dan Lacivita

quote: We are only three decades into one of the most important revolutions the world has ever seen. In design development terms, that is a mere blink.
author: Rachel Hinman

quote: We are so busying measuring public opinion that we forget we can mold it. We are so busy listening to statistics we forget we can create them.
author: Bill Bernbach

quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, therefore, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

quote: We aren’t designing photocopies of web pages, we’re designing web pages.
author: Andy Clarke

quote: We cannot learn without pain.
author: Aristotle

quote: We can’t just design an item that looks great. We also have to anticipate how it is boxed up, distributed, and shipped, as well as whether or not a seventeen-year-old kid with a summer job can stock it on the store shelf without ruining it.
author: Robin Perkins

quote: We can’t solve problems by using the same kind of thinking we used when we created them.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: We didn't lose the game; we just ran out of time.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: We don’t get hired to make pretty things or win design awards. We get hired to solve business problems.
author: James Bradley

quote: We explore promising avenues that, days later, become dead ends. Sometimes, we solve a month’s problem in an hour.
author: Cennydd Bowles

quote: We have a strategic plan. It’s called doing things.
author: Herb Kelleher

quote: We have always been shameless about stealing great ideas.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: We have art to save ourselves from the truth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: We have to learn to see technical devices and software as others see them. Feeling a sense of pride in getting a device to do what we want doesn’t mean we’re clever, it means the design was wrong.
author: Jeremy Allison

quote: We live in a society where everybody feels guilty. We want to do good, but we don’t want to get out of the house. A brand can help us feel good if you buy this yogurt.
author: Mark Gobé

quote: We make the whole widget.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: We need to shift from designing applications to designing implications.
author: Anthony Dunne & Fiona Raby

quote: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: We read best what we read most.
author: Zuzana Licko

quote: We should pursue and practice moderation.
author: Plato

quote: We tend to forget there’s more to design than designing.
author: Justin Ahrens

quote: We unfortunately live in a corporate world where group decision making is made to avoid failure rather than to achieve success.
author: Bill Cahan

quote: We use the letters of our alphabet every day with the utmost ease and unconcern, taking them for granted as the air we breathe. We do not realize that each of these letters is at our service today only as the result of a long and laboriously slow process of evolution in the age-old art of writing.
author: Douglas C. McMurtle

quote: Web design has a bad reputation for being stylistically trendy and same-looking. Some guy does a parallax scrolling site, and now your boss wants you to add that to your corporate PR website for some reason. Glossy buttons, Gaussian Noise, linen texture, new things that look fake-old, then back to minimalism and flat colors as a reaction to the glossy noisy textured fake-old stuff.
author: Jonas Downey

quote: Web design is art wrapped in technology.
author: James Weaver

quote: Web design is responsive design. Responsive web design is web design, done right.
author: Andy Clarke

quote: Web design is the creation of digital environments that facilitate and encourage human activity; reflect or adapt to individual voices and content; and change gracefully over time while always retaining their identity.
author: Jeffrey Zeldman

quote: Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning.
author: Unknown

quote: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Well established hierarchies are not easily uprooted.
author: Tao Te Ching

quote: Well you’re in your little room and you’re working on something good but if it’s really good you’re gonna need a bigger room and when you’re in the bigger room you might not know what to do you might have to think of how you got started sitting in your little room (from the song “Little Room”)
author: Jack White

quote: We’re all naturally curious when we’re eight years old. But as most people get older, they become less and less curious, so they ask other people to be curious for them. That’s what I do for a living.
author: Ron Miriello

quote: What I love about design is the artistic and scientific complexity that also becomes useful…
author: Michelle Obama

quote: What I’m trying to produce is the visual equivalent of the chord change that makes the hairs on the back of your neck stand up.
author: Rian Hughes

quote: What garlic is to food, insanity is to art.
author: Unknown

quote: What is to be sought in designs for the display of information is the clear portrayal of complexity. Not the complication of the simple; rather the task of the designer is to give visual access to the subtle and the difficult – that is, revelation of the complex.
author: Edward Tufte

quote: What makes great design great is not a trendy technique, but the logic and conceptual aspect that were figured out in the designer’s mind – or on more likely, on paper – before a mouse cursor ever opened Photoshop.
author: Kyle Meyer

quote: What problem have you solved, ever, that was worth solving where you knew all the given information in advance? No problem worth solving is like that. In the real world; you have a surplus of information and you have to filter it or; you don’t have sufficient information and you have to go find some.
author: Dan Meyer

quote: What we got here is… failure to communicate.
author: Cool Hand Luke

quote: What works good is better than what looks good, because what works good lasts.
author: Ray Eames

quote: What’s the hardest thing to communicate? The hardest thing is to communicate.
author: Michael Cina

quote: When Einstein realized, “Dear me, this universe with its wonders all adds up to E=mc2?,” he did not stop to think whether this concept would sell better set in Futura or Antikva.
author: Kari Piippo

quote: When I am down, [I am] not good at any work, including design work.
author: Stefan Sagmeister

quote: When I am working on a problem, I never think about beauty. I only think about how to solve the problem. But when I have finished, if the solution isn’t beautiful, I know it is wrong.
author: Richard Buckminster Fuller

quote: When I complained about being paid fifty dollars for an article that had taken me a week to write, he [Kurt] said I should take into account what it would have cost me to take out a two-page ad announcing that I could write.
author: Mark Vonnegut

quote: When I design, I don’t consider the technical or commercial parameters so much as the desire for a dream that humans have attempted to project onto an object.
author: Philippe Starck

quote: When a company gets to certain size, it’s easy just to let things happen. You have to constantly craft and nurture a brand. You can’t just let it be or it’ll fritter away to mediocrity.
author: Fiona Morrison

quote: When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code.
author: Richard Pattis

quote: When designing an interface, imagine that your program is all that stands between the user and hot, sweaty, tangled-bedsheets-fingertips-digging-into-the-back sex.
author: Randall Munroe

quote: When graphic designers got bored with the perfection offered by the newly arrived computers that could render artwork to within a tiny pixel, they rebelled by writing programmes that randomized individual letters and whole pages every time a printer processed them. A designer who didn’t like what a copywriter had delivered even set that text in illegible pictograms and icons.
author: Erik Spiekermann

quote: When in doubt, leave it out.
author: Joshua Bloch

quote: When in doubt, use Caslon.
author: William Caslon

quote: When is the last time you saw a Lamborghini sale?
author: Chris Campbell

quote: When it comes to writing code, the number one most important skill is how to keep a tangle of features from collapsing under the weight of its own complexity.
author: John D. Cook

quote: When one person suffers from a delusion it is called insanity; when many people suffer from a delusion it is called religion.
author: Robert Pirsig

quote: When the light turns green, you go. When the light turns red, you stop. But what do you do when the light turns blue with orange and lavender spots?
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: When the only tool you own is a hammer, every problem begins to resemble a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: When the solution is simple, God is answering.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: When typography is on point, words become images.
author: Shawn Lukas

quote: When we engage in what we are naturally suited to do, our work takes on the quality of play and it is play that stimulates creativity.
author: Linda Naiman

quote: When we feel less secure, with less control over our daily lives, we reach out to brands to connect with a time when things seemed better.
author: Mark Gobe

quote: When we have clients who are thinking about Flash splash pages, we tell them to go to their local supermarket and bring a mime with them. Have the mime stand in front of the supermarket, and, as each customer tries to enter, do a little show that lasts two minutes, welcoming them to the supermarket and trying to explain the bread is on aisle six and milk is on sale today. Then stand back and count how many people watch the mime, how many people get past the mime as quickly as possible, and how many people punch the mime out. That should give you a good idea as to how well their splash page will be received.
author: Jared Spool

quote: When we think of design, we usually imagine things that are chosen because they are designed. Vases or comic books or architecture… It turns out, though, that most of what we make or design is actually aimed at a public that is there for something else. The design is important, but the design is not the point. Call it “public design”… Public design is for individuals who have to fill out our tax form, interact with our website or check into our hotel room despite the way it’s designed, not because of it.
author: Seth Godin

quote: When you are stuck, walk away from the computer and draw. It will teach you how to see.
author: Gerard Huerta

quote: When you do something, you should burn yourself up completely, like a good bonfire, leaving no trace of yourself.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

quote: When you do the common things in life in an uncommon way, you will command the attention of the world.
author: George Washington Carver

quote: When you do things right, people won’t be sure you’ve done anything at all.
author: God (from Futurama)

quote: When you make something no one hates, no one loves it.
author: Tibor Kalman

quote: When your computer starts falling apart, stop hitting it with a Hammer!
author: Unknown

quote: When you’re a carpenter making a beautiful chest of drawers, you’re not going to use a piece of plywood on the back, even though it faces the wall and nobody will ever see it. You’ll know it’s there, so you’re going to use a beautiful piece of wood on the back. For you to sleep well at night, the aesthetic, the quality, has to be carried all the way through.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: When you’re passionate about what you do, you become an evangelist for the very thing you do.
author: Jonathan Snook

quote: Whenever I climb I am followed by a dog called 'Ego'.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Whenever I have an idea I write it down, even if it’s not a very good idea. Sometimes the bad ideas will lead to better ones.
author: Steven Snell

quote: Where I come from, gettin’ visual is habitual.
author: GZA

quote: Where do new ideas come from? The answer is simple: differences. Creativity comes from unlikely juxtapositions.
author: Nicholas Negroponte

quote: Where you innovate, how you innovate, and what you innovate are design problems.
author: Tim Brown

quote: Whether the task is writing, design, or hanging a picture straight, it is obvious that we do our best work when healthy, rested, refreshed, alert, and eager to do the job for its own sake.
author: Jeffrey Zeldman

quote: Whether we like it or not, our legacy as designers is ugly. We’re largely responsible for fueling a culture of consumption.
author: Eric Karjaluoto

quote: Whether you think that you can, or that you can't, you are usually right.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Whether you think you can or whether you think you can’t – you are right.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Who is General Failure? And why is he reading my disk?
author: Unknown

quote: Whoever best describes the problem, is the one most likely to solve it.
author: Dan Roam

quote: Whoever tells the best story wins.
author: Annette Simmons

quote: Why do we never have time to do it right, but always have time to do it over?
author: Unknown

quote: Why expect spec work from a graphic designer when you don’t expect the same from a dentist?
author: Samadara Ginige

quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next, skill is knowing how to do it, and virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr

quote: With type as with philosophy, music and food, it is better to have a little of the best than to be swamped with the derivative, the careless, the routine.
author: Robert Bringhurst

quote: Without deviation from the norm progress is not possible.
author: Frank Zappa

quote: Without good design it is easy to miss the point.
author: Bjarni Wark

quote: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty “text” file.
author: Louis Srygley

quote: Women might be able to fake orgasms. But men can fake a whole relationship.
author: Sharon Stone

quote: Wonderfully designed > beautifully designed. Any day.
author: Daniel Burka

quote: Wondering is the seed of genius.
author: William Mocca

quote: Work hard and be nice to people. No one is born with the ability, and no one owes you anything. If you want to do something, start small and build it up. Then keep doing it!
author: Jon Hicks

quote: Work your ass off. Don’t be an asshole.
author: Stefan Sagmeister

quote: Worry is essentially a misuse of imagination.
author: Alex Osborn

quote: Write drunk; edit sober.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Write it down. You will lose thoughts, you thought, that you thought.
author: Vanessa Workoff

quote: You are what you are seen to be.
author: Erik Spiekermann

quote: You are what you share.
author: Charles Leadbeater

quote: You came here because we do this better than you, and part of that is letting our creatives be unproductive until they are.
author: Don Draper

quote: You can avoid reality, but you cannot avoid the consequences of avoiding reality.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: You can be misunderstood exactly once. After that, you are not being misunderstood; you are communicating poorly.
author: Josh Collinsworth

quote: You can be watching TV and see Coca-Cola, and you know that the President drinks Coke, Liz Taylor drinks Coke, and just think, you can drink Coke, too. A Coke is a Coke and no amount of money can get you a better Coke than the one the bum on the corner is drinking. All the Cokes are the same and all the Cokes are good. Liz Taylor knows it, the President knows it, the bum knows it, and you know it.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: You can design and create, and build the most wonderful place in the world. But it takes people to make the dream a reality.
author: Walt Disney

quote: You can have an art experience in front of a Rembrandt or in front of a piece of graphic design.
author: Stefan Sagmeister

quote: You can kill a man but you can’t kill an idea.
author: Medgar Evers

quote: You can never underestimate the stupidity of the general public.
author: Scott Adams

quote: You can observe a lot just by watching.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: You can only find truth with logic if you have already found truth without it.
author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

quote: You can stand on the shoulders of giants OR a big enough pile of dwarfs, works either way.
author: Unknown

quote: You can tear a poem apart to see what makes it tick. You’re back with the mystery of having been moved by words. The best craftsmanship always leaves holes and gaps so that something that is not in the poem can creep, crawl, flash or thunder in.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: You can use an eraser on the drafting table or a sledge hammer on the construction site.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: You cannot not communicate.
author: Paul Watzlawik

quote: You can’t build a reputation on what you’re going to do.
author: Henry Ford

quote: You can’t do better design with a computer, but you can speed up your work enormously.
author: Wim Crouwel

quote: You can’t improvise on nothing man; you’ve gotta improvise on something.
author: Charles Mingus

quote: You do a disservice to your clients when you don’t fire the bad ones because you eventually provide poor service to those you don’t want to serve.
author: Jason M. Blumer

quote: You do not need to have a great idea before you can begin working; you need to begin working before you can have a great idea.
author: Josh Collinsworth

quote: You don’t get harmony if everyone sings the same note.
author: Steve Honey

quote: You don’t have to be “a creative” to be creative.
author: Drory Ben-Menachem

quote: You don’t think your way to creative work. You work your way to creative thinking.
author: George Nelson

quote: You get up early in the morning and you work all day. That’s the only secret.
author: Philip Glass

quote: You have to be interested in culture to design for it.
author: Lorraine Wild

quote: You have to finish things — that’s what you learn from, you learn by finishing things.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: You have to roll up your sleeves and be a stonecutter before you can become a sculptor – command of craft always precedes art: apprentice, journeyman, master.
author: Philip Gerard

quote: You may not be interested in war, but war is interested in you.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: You miss 100 percent of the shots you never take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

quote: You mix a bunch of ingredients, and once in a great while, chemistry happens.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: You must have chaos in your soul to give birth to a dancing star.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: You never can do what the kids do. What you do is look at yourself and find your own way to address the fact that the times have changed and that you have to pay attention. You can’t be a designer and say, “Oh, this is timeless.” Nothing is timeless!
author: Paula Scher

quote: You start coding. I’ll go find out what they want.
author: Unknown

quote: You want it in one line? Does it have to fit in 80 columns?
author: Larry Wall

quote: You want something done, ask someone busy.
author: Mat Helme

quote: You're bound to be unhappy if you optimize everything.
author: Donald E. Knuth

quote: Your best work is your expression of yourself. Now, you may not be the greatest at it, but when you do it, you’re the only expert.
author: Frank Gehry

quote: Your imagination is the hood ornament on the car of creativity.
author: Gary Busey

quote: Your opinion won’t matter. It’s important that you prove your point with numbers.
author: Samantha LeVan

quote: Y’all talk about UX like it’s just another feature. For a user, it literally is the product. Full stop. Everything else is inside baseball.
author: Startup L. Jackson

quote: [Degenerate type is] a form of canned cynicism which will doom its perpetrators to a special room in hell where lovely little children of all races, creeds, and religions are eternally batched in gentle rosy and amber glows, singing “It’s a small world after all.” There’s no reason to create an alphabet which looks like it leaked out a diaper.
author: Peter Fraterdeus

quote: [Designers’] primary competence lies not in the technicalities of a craft but in the mastery of a process.
author: Ralph Caplan

quote: [If] people are made safer, more comfortable, more eager to purchase, more efficient, or just happier, the designer has succeeded.
author: Henry Dreyfuss

quote: a 5% feature (used by less than 5% of all users) is a distraction for all the other users, and is better removed, unless it’s really critical (a small number of users do need to cancel service, for example).
author: Neil Hunt

quote: ‎Heaven, I believe, is right here, just waiting for us to create it.
author: Jesse Scaccia

quote: “Fun” is a tricky word. People think that if you’re having “fun”, you’re ignoring content, or you’re ignoring the importance of the piece. But that’s not true.
author: Carin Goldberg

quote: “It looks good” is the worst feedback you can get.
author: Whitney Hess

quote: “What is the most treasured and well-used piece of equipment in your studio?” My head.
author: Alan Fletcher

quote: Another misinterpretation that’s always bugged me: Ship early, ship often OR Ship quality product. Quality isn’t something to be sacrificed. Ship early, ship often, sacrificing features, never quality.
author: Kyle Neath

quote: People in the newspaper industry saw the web as a newspaper. People in TV saw the web as TV, and people in book publishing saw it as a weird kind of potential book. But the web is not just some kind of magic all-absorbing meta-medium. It’s its own thing.
author: Paul Ford

quote: Try to absorb what is useful, discard what is useless, and add what is essentially your own.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: Good design is innovative. Good design makes a product useful. Good design is aesthetic. Good design helps a product to be understood. Good design is unobtrusive. Good design is honest. Good design is durable. Good design is thorough to the last detail. Good design is concerned with the environment. Good design is as little design as possible.
author: Dieter Rams

quote: The wisest course of action is to take your best shot with a prototype, immediately get to market, and iterate quickly. If you wait for ideal circumstances in which you have all the information you need (which is impossible) the market will pass you by.
author: Guy Kawasaki

quote: Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: We need to understand the reason behind the rules in order to break them. Design by principles, not standards, and you'll cease to be surprised by your own opinions.
author: José Rafael Vieira

quote: Less is only more when more is no good.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A decision's merit cannot be awarded by future outcomes. Decisions have merit because the future is unknown, not in spite of it.
author: José Rafael Vieira

quote: Man is said to be a reasoning animal. I do not know why he has not been defined as an affective or feeling animal. Perhaps that which differentiates him from other animals is feeling rather than reason. More often I have seen a cat reason than laugh or weep. Perhaps it weeps or laughs inwardly — but then perhaps, also inwardly, the crab resolves equations of the second degree.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: I have yet to see any problem, however complicated, which, when looked at in the right way did not become still more complicated.
author: Poul Anderson
